title: Super random, but thanks to Riot
body:
The new Shaco icons look super beautiful and fitting. I don't know how to get the person who made the art to read this, but lots and lots and LOTS of thumbs up and applause. It's friggin amazing. Makes me want to main Shaco despite not using him outside one or two rifts and lots of aram draws.

Related note- can you do Eve's icons? With how much you captured the terror clown with the icon art, I think you could get the essence of Eve as well :D.

He's not getting updated, but maybe Kennen? He **is** after all getting a new skin and he could use some love :P

How much work goes into making these newer ability icons (time wise)? They're very pretty, but obviously not in the same work category as a splash art.

Also, when making NEW icons, what guidelines are you guys following that you didn't in the past. I noticed, for instance, you guys tend to really stick to one primary color when making these new icons. For instance, kayle's old outdated icons used to look pretty bad and mismatched, and unclear. her new ones all use red/orange/warm colors.
While it's true that it takes much more art time to make a splash, the icons can go through several rounds of design feedback to make sure they are conveying the ability correctly.

She doesn't have any currently in development but any champions with low quality icons are on the table to get updated ones some day.
Huh. I wonder, do you _really_ consider Quinn's ability icons "low quality"? They seem to fit today's standards.
They're not really as colorful and detailed as the newer ones, like Lux's and Gangplank's.
I don't think that icons need to necessarily be very colorful/flashy.
They don't, but icons that vary wildly in style and detail aren't going to help much in establishing a visual and artistic consistency for League.
